models.user: A job seeker using the platform with imported LinkedIn profile data, skills, experience, and account information.
models.resume: A generated resume document, either a master version or tailored for a specific job posting.
models.workExperience: Individual job positions showing career history with company, title, dates, and accomplishments.
models.education: Academic credentials including schools attended, degrees earned, and completion dates.
models.skill: Professional skills and competencies with endorsement counts from LinkedIn connections.
models.optimizationSuggestion: AI-generated recommendations to improve resume effectiveness and impact.

relationships: User contains personal information, work experience, education, and skills
Work Experience entries are ordered chronologically to show career progression
Skills can have endorsement counts from LinkedIn connections
Optimization Suggestions target specific sections of the resume for improvement

user.headline: Senior Product Manager | SaaS & AI Products | Ex-Google
user.summary: Results-driven product manager with 8+ years of experience launching and scaling B2B SaaS products. Passionate about leveraging AI to solve complex user problems. Led products from 0 to $10M ARR at high-growth startups. Strong cross-functional leader with expertise in product strategy, roadmapping, and data-driven decision making.

workExperience.description: Lead product strategy and execution for AI-powered analytics platform serving 500+ enterprise customers.
accomplishments: Launched AI-driven insights feature that increased user engagement by 45% and drove $3M in new revenue
Led cross-functional team of 12 engineers, designers, and data scientists through complete product redesign
Established data-driven product development process, reducing time-to-market by 30%
Grew product from $2M to $10M ARR in 2 years through strategic feature prioritization

workExperience.description: Managed cloud infrastructure products for Google Cloud Platform, focusing on developer tools and automation.
accomplishments: Shipped 3 major features for Cloud Build that increased customer adoption by 60%
Collaborated with engineering teams across 4 countries to deliver seamless CI/CD experience
Conducted 100+ user interviews to inform product roadmap and feature prioritization
Presented product vision and quarterly updates to VP-level stakeholders

workExperience.description: First product hire at early-stage B2B SaaS startup. Built product from concept to 50 paying customers.
accomplishments: Defined product vision and roadmap for project management tool targeting creative agencies
Conducted market research and competitive analysis to identify product-market fit
Launched MVP in 4 months with limited engineering resources
Gathered continuous customer feedback through weekly user testing sessions

highlights: Teaching Assistant for CS147: Introduction to HCI
Published research on AI-driven user interfaces

sections.summary: Results-driven product manager with 8+ years of experience launching and scaling B2B SaaS products. Passionate about leveraging AI to solve complex user problems. Led products from 0 to $10M ARR at high-growth startups. Strong cross-functional leader with expertise in product strategy, roadmapping, and data-driven decision making.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Quantify your impact in the summary
optimizationSuggestions.description: Add specific metrics about team size, budget, or revenue impact to make your summary more compelling. For example, mention the number of products you've launched or total ARR managed.
optimizationSuggestions.suggestion: Consider adding: 'Led product teams of 10-15 people managing $15M+ in ARR across 3 major product lines.'

optimizationSuggestions.title: Add industry-relevant keywords
optimizationSuggestions.description: Your resume would rank higher for PM roles if you include more industry-standard keywords. Consider adding terms like 'OKRs', 'product-market fit', 'go-to-market strategy', and 'stakeholder management'.
optimizationSuggestions.suggestion: Integrate these keywords naturally into your accomplishment bullets, especially in your most recent role.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Group skills by category
optimizationSuggestions.description: Organizing your skills into categories (Technical, Product, Leadership) makes it easier for recruiters to scan and shows the breadth of your expertise.
optimizationSuggestions.suggestion: Create three skill groups: Technical Skills (SQL, A/B Testing, Product Analytics), Product Skills (Roadmapping, User Research, Product Strategy), and Leadership Skills (Cross-functional Leadership, Agile Methodologies).

optimizationSuggestions.title: Lead with action verbs
optimizationSuggestions.description: Some of your bullets start with weak phrases. Strong action verbs like 'Drove', 'Spearheaded', 'Orchestrated', and 'Transformed' create more impact than 'Managed' or 'Worked on'.
optimizationSuggestions.suggestion: Review your TechFlow bullets and replace 'Led cross-functional team' with 'Orchestrated cross-functional team' and 'Established data-driven process' with 'Transformed product development by establishing data-driven process'.
